FuncDef: The display l2-multicast ipv6 forwarding-table command displays the IPv6 Layer 2 multicast forwarding table. If a VLAN is specified, the forwarding entries of the specified VLAN are displayed. If no VLAN is specified, all forwarding entries are displayed. The display l2-multicast ipv6 forwarding-table command displays the IPv6 Layer 2 multicast forwarding table. If a VLAN is specified, the forwarding entries of the specified VLAN are displayed. If no VLAN is specified, all forwarding entries are displayed. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: display l2-multicast ipv6 forwarding-table [ vlan <vlan-id> [ [ source <source-address-v6> ] group <group-address-v6> ] ] [ slot <slot-id> [ cpu <cpu-id> ] ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays entries in a specified VLAN.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Specifies a multicast source address and displays information about the forwarding table corresponding to the multicast source.
The value is a 32-bit hexadecimal string in format X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Indicates the address of an IPv6 multicast group. It is used to specify an IPv6 multicast group and display the forwarding table corresponding to the group.
The value is a 32-bit hexadecimal string in format X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Displays entry information in the specified slot.
The value is a string of 1 to 23  case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Displays entry information of the specified CPU ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4.

ExtraInfo:
You can use this command to view information about the Layer 2 multicast forwarding table, including dynamically generated and statically added entries.
An entry contains information about the multicast source, multicast group, outbound interface, and VLAN to which the packet belongs.
